p: Nondo et al. [ 141] reported that ethanol and methanol extracts exhibit significant antiplasmodial activity against Plasmodium (P.) falciparum with an IC 50 = 2.43 μg/mL and 2.05 μg/mL, respectively. Moreover, the fractions isolated from H. pubescens roots are highly active against chloroquine-resistant P. falciparum (K1, Dd2) and artemisinin-resistant P. falciparum. Another study [ 24], showed that the steroidal alkaloid conessine isolated from H. pubescens bark showed anti-plasmodial activity with an IC₅₀ value of 1.9 μg/mL.
